title: The Mystery Of The Game Awards Monolith Appears To Have Been Spoiled By A Trademark Filing
description: GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.                                          It's been a busy week for...
body:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.
  
              
          
                It's been a busy week for industry speculation after Geoff Keighley started posting about a mysterious, glowing monolith in the middle of the California desert, which was later moved into Los Angeles. Now, it appears the monolith's mystery might have just been solved through a trademark filing.Rumors that the monolith was erected to tease new Diablo 4 content, Elder Scrolls 6, God of War, or Lords of the Fallen 2 were all shot down by people in the know. While others speculated that it still could be related to The Elder Scrolls Online, or a new FromSoft game, it appears most likely that the statue is promoting a new Divinity title from Larian.A trio of trademark filings were spotted up by MP1st, including a new Divinity logo and a symbol that looks suspiciously like the glowing one on Geoff Keighley's monolith. The familiar-looking trademarks come after Larian's publishing director said there aren't currently any plans for a Divinity: Original Sin 3, meaning the upcoming title may be a new Divinity game outside of the Original Sin prequel series.The logos trademarked bear a striking resemblance to the monolith's imagery.A recent PlayStation Store database leak revealed that Divinity: Original Sin 2 is getting a Definitive Edition release on the PS5, but it's likely that the statue and the new trademark filings relate to a brand new title in the Divinity series.The Game Awards is not far away now, airing on December 11 live from Los Angeles. Despite being over two years old now, Larian's Baldur's Gate 3 is up for an award again, earning another nomination for Best Community Support. This year's frontrunner looks to be Clair Obscur: Expedition 33, which earned a record-breaking 12 nominations. Plenty of worthy games also failed to make the cut: check out our list of The Game Awards' biggest snubs for 2025.
                                  
  
    Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com

title: Roblox System Requirements
description: GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.                                          Roblox is one of the biggest...
body:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.
  
              
          
                Roblox is one of the biggest games in the world, with millions of different experiences that players can hop into. One of the biggest selling points is that it can be played practically anywhere, from phones to Xbox to a standard computer.Of course, not everyone has a PC rig the size of a monster truck, and some folks just want to know if their old laptop or similar device can run Roblox, or find out why they’re running into issues. So, to help you out, we’re listing the exact Roblox system requirements below.Roblox Supported Platforms You can fire up Roblox on almost any platform, but just in case you’re having trouble loading it up, here are the basic requirements across different platforms:PC/Windows: Must use 64-bit Windows 10 or 11Mac: macOS 10.13 (High Sierra) or neweriOS: iOS 13 or laterAndroid: Android 8.0 or laterChrome OS: Chrome OS version 53 or higherRoblox Minimum System Requirements for PC If you are trying to get Roblox running on your PC, or bumping into any issues with the title, here are the minimum system hardware requirements for Roblox, as officially stated by the developer.Graphics Card: On PC/Windows, the Roblox application requires DirectX 10 or higher feature level support. For the best performance, we recommend either a computer less than 5 years old with a dedicated video card or a laptop less than 3 years old with an integrated video card.Processor: Roblox recommends you have a recent processor (2005+) with a clock speed of 1.6 GHz or better. There have been some issues with older AMD processors.RAM or Memory: Roblox recommends you have at least 1 GB of memory on Windows 10 or Windows 11.Storage Space: Roblox recommends you have at least 300 MB of system storage space to install Roblox.Roblox Performance Tips and TricksIf you’re a Roblox player with all of the specs listed above, but still running into issues, here are a few tips and tricks that may improve your Roblox performance:It’s recommended to have a PC with at least 4 GB RAM or aboveA PC with a dedicated graphics card will run Roblox much betterSSD Storage will improve loading times across the boardA better internet connection may improve your experience, so check your broadband connection and bandwidth
                                  
  
    Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com

title: Roblox The Forge Tier List - Best Weapon, Pickaxe, and Race
description: GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.                                              With the latest Roblox...
body:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.
  
    
              
          
                With the latest Roblox craze, The Forge, there is just so much content to dig into that it’s tough to know where to begin. Thankfully, we’re here to mark a big X on the right spot for you, breaking down the best of the best when it comes to weapons and races in this underground escapade. So if you’re yearning to explore further in the mine, then our tier lists covering weapons, pickaxes, and races will help.The Forge Weapon Tier ListAs you explore the depths of The Forge, it is very important to pack a formidable weapon, so you can wipe out enemies and grab yourself even more exclusive ore. Ore what? Well, we wouldn’t like to say. So avoid wiping out and waking up on the surface, with our The Forge weapon tier list below:TierThe Forge WeaponSComically Large Spoon, Crusader Sword, Double Battle Axe, Dragon Slayer, Scythe, Skull Crusher,ABoxing Gloves, Cutlass, Chaos, Great Sword, Hammer, Relevator, TachiBFalchion Sword, Gladius Daggers, Iron Hand, UchigatanaCDagger, Falchion Knife, Hook, RapierThe Forge Pickaxe Tier ListWeapons are just half the battle in The Forge, as when you chip away at the walls, you will need a strong pickaxe if you hope to mine those rare ores. So, get ready to gear up and grab some of the finest minerals this side of the surface with our The Forge pickaxe tier list, below:TierThe Forge PickaxeSArcane Pickaxe, Demonic Pickaxe, Magma PickaxeACobalt Pickaxe, Mythril Pickaxe, Lightite Pickaxe, Titanium Pickaxe, Uranium PickaxeBPlatinum Pickaxe, Stonewake’s Pickaxe, Golden PickaxeCIron Pickaxe, Bronze Pickaxe, Stone PickaxeThe Forge Race Tier ListThe Forge has quite a lot of depth (sorry), and while your weapon and pickaxe are crucial for picking up the best resources and smashing enemies, you also need to consider your race. These determine which buffs you have, which can make all the difference as you explore. Plus, much like real life, we wouldn’t advise being human.TierThe Forge RaceSAngel, DemonADragonborn, Dwarf, GolemBMinotaur, Shadow, OrcCElf, Goblin, Human, Undead, Zombie
                                  
  
    Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com
